citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
The facility’s written program of veterinary care, avian environmental enhancement plan, and contingency plan were not
available for review at the time of inspection. These written programs records are necessary to assess compliance with
the regulations and standards, thus helping to ensure proper veterinary care and animal welfare. Ensure the written
program of veterinary care, avian environmental enhancement plan, contingency plan, and all required records are
available for review by APHIS officials at the time of inspections.
Correct by: November 25, 2024.

At the time of inspection, the licensee was housing a nursing female Russian dwarf hamsters and pups with
approximately eight other non-nursing Russian dwarf hamsters. Housing other hamsters with a nursing female hamster
and her litter may lead to injury or death of the nursing pups. A nursing female hamster, together with her litter, shall be
housed in a primary enclosure that contains no other hamsters and that provides at least 121 square inches of floor
space, and 25 square inches of floor space for nursing female dwarf hamsters.
Correct by November 25, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.126(a)  Repeat
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
The facility’s written program of veterinary care, avian environmental enhancement plan, and contingency plan were not 
available for review at the time of inspection. These written programs records are necessary to assess compliance with 
the regulations and standards, thus helping to ensure proper veterinary care and animal welfare. Ensure the written 
program of veterinary care, avian environmental enhancement plan, contingency plan, and all required records are 
available for review by APHIS officials at the time of inspections.  
 
Correct by: November 25, 2024. 
3.28(c)(2)(iv) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
At the time of inspection, the licensee was housing a nursing female Russian dwarf hamsters and pups with 
approximately eight other non-nursing Russian dwarf hamsters. Housing other hamsters with a nursing female hamster 
and her litter may lead to injury or death of the nursing pups. A nursing female hamster, together with her litter, shall be 
housed in a primary enclosure that contains no other hamsters and that provides at least 121 square inches of floor 
space, and 25 square inches of floor space for nursing female dwarf hamsters.  
 
Correct by November 25, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
 n
